frameDefinitions: In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a  Responsible_party.
This frame has to do with the bias or lack of bias of a Judge making an assessment concerning two or more Sides.
This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
A Cognizer makes a Decision, which may be about an entity or a course of action.
In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.
frameExamples: It would <t>behoove</t> us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples
Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is mandatory.
A location in which the <fen>Duty</fen>  obtains.
This Frame Element marks the person whose objectivity in making assesment is being evaluated.
This Frame Element marks one of the <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or one of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks phrases jointly expressing both <fen>Sides</fen> in a dispute or all of the alternatives in a situation of choice.
The second-mentioned of the <fen>Sides</fen> to a dispute or alternatives in a situation of choice.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate how the bias of the <fen>Judge</fen> expresses itself in their behavior or actions.
The <fen>Dispute</fen> is the situation in which there is some conflict between two sides.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Decision_maker</fen>.
This role denotes the time when the partiality occurs.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides on a course of action.
<fen>Decision</fen> identifies the entity or course of action upon which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides.
The time or time period over which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the decision.
The place where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the decision.
The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Getting a shot against yellow fever</fex> is obligatory for travellers to Benin.
The use of TM software is obligatory <fex>for every freelance translator working on projects for our company</fex>.
<fex>These days</fex>, wearing a seat-belt is mandatory.
Gymnasium is not obligatory <fex>in Sweden</fex>, but nearly everyone attends gymnasium
<fex>The referee</fex> was totally biased against our team.
The umpire was partial <fex>to the home team</fex>.
The judge was neutral <fex>between the parties</fex>.
The judge favored the defendant <fex>over the plaintiff</fex>.
My sister remained neutral <fex>in our disputes</fex>.
He had a neutral <fex>smile</fex> on his face.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
The State Cabinet <fex>today</fex> decided to file an appeal in the Supreme Court seeking an extension of six months for implementation of its judgment
<fex>At the first</fex> crossroad we decided to wait.

the Financial Management and Accountability Act
the National Indigenous Literacy and Numeracy Strategy
the ActMaking of agreements(1) This Act
the end of each funding year
